original: HOLM, John, Disponent, Stockholm, f Sthlm 29/11 74, gm Agda Synnerholm. Ad Fredr folksk o Jakobs Allm lärov, Sthlm, prakt inom bokb, etui- o kartongfabrikation Sthlm 90—99. Anst i samma ind i USA 99—14. Egen rör i branschen 14—23 fma AB Nord Kartongfabr, som övertogs av Sthlms Kartong- o Litogr AB 23, disp där. Ag fastigh Upplandsgat 70, Sthlm. Styr.led Fastigh.bol Tre Länkar O F, Sthlm. Resor: Danm, Norge, Finl, Tyskl, Österr, Schweiz, Ital, Frankr, Engl, USA. Patr Sällsk st GM. Medl Odd Fellow-logen 24 Birger Jarl, led av dess drät-selnmd, medl Frn 1874 års män. Borgare i Sthlm 19, medl av Borgargillet mm. Hed.-led Sångfrn Verdandi, Providence R I, USA.
translated: HOLM, John, Manager, Stockholm, b. Stockholm 29/11 1874, m. Agda Synnerholm. Educated at Fredriks folkskola and Jakobs Allmänna läroverk in Stockholm, practical training in bookbinding, case and cardboard manufacturing in Stockholm 1890-1899. Employed in the same industry in the USA 1899-1914. Established own business in the industry 1914-1923 as part of AB Nord Kartongfabrik, which was taken over by Sthlms Kartong- och Litogr AB in 1923, where he worked as a manager. Owned property at Upplandsgatan 70, Stockholm. Board member of Fastighetsbolaget Tre Länkar O F, Stockholm. Travels: Denmark, Norway, Finland, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Italy, France, England, USA. Active member of the Masonic Lodge. Member of the Odd Fellow Lodge 24 Birger Jarl, serving on its council, and member of the Från 1874 års män society. Became a citizen of Stockholm in 1919 and a member of the Borgargillet, among others. Honorary member of the choir Verdandi, Providence RI, USA.

structured.name: John Holm
structured.description: John Holm (b. November 29, 1874) was a Swedish manager based in Stockholm. He was married to Agda Synnerholm. He completed his education at Fredriks folkskola and Jakobs Allmänna läroverk, specializing in bookbinding, case and cardboard manufacturing. John Holm worked in the industry in the United States from 1899 to 1914 before establishing his own business as part of AB Nord Kartongfabrik. He later worked as a manager at Sthlms Kartong- och Litogr AB. John Holm was involved in various organizations including Fastighetsbolaget Tre Länkar O F, the Masonic Lodge, Odd Fellow Lodge 24 Birger Jarl, Från 1874 års män, Borgargillet, and Verdandi. He owned property at Upplandsgatan 70, Stockholm. John Holm traveled extensively to Denmark, Norway, Finland, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Italy, France, England, and the USA.

career.occupational_title: Practical Training in Bookbinding, Case and Cardboard Manufacturing
